p: Since many triterpenoids isolated from plants of the family Schisandraceae are reported to reduce the risk of liver diseases and cancer, compounds 93– 100 were evaluated for in vitro cytotoxicity against human hepaticellular liver carcinoma cell (HepG2), according to the MTT method, with cisplatin as the positive control (IC 50 value of 9.8 ± 0.21 µM). Compounds 93– 100, showed moderate cytotoxic activity with IC 50 values ranging from 14.3 to 21.3 µM (IC 50 values of compounds 93: 15.6 µM, 94: 16.1 µM, 95: 16.4 µM, 96: 15.4 µM, 97: 17.9 µM, 98: 18.8 µM, 99: 14.3 µM, 100: 21.3 µM). It should be noted that those metabolites 93– 100 produced during fermentation showed stronger cytotoxicity to HepG2 cell line than that of nigranoic acid, the main component of non-fermented K. angustifolia [ 39].
